author: andschwa
body: Judging by the `project.json` [schema](http://json.schemastore.org/project) and the `dotnet-cli` [specs](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/blob/03885e876fcf35c88c50c0f6d4a4feccb24301bc/Documentation/specs/runtime-configuration-file.md), enabling different compilation flags for multiple configurations for #17 should be doable.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Also while doing this, I'd like to use the `content` section to deploy the profile and ps1xml files, since it looks like it's now implemented.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This is dependent on [support](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/465) from dotnet-cli.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
We enabled a `Linux` configuration such that `LINUX` is defined only when specified. Theoretically, the new [runtimes](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/pkg/Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms/runtime.json) support may allow us to do this automatically.

We moved the `CORECLR` define to the `dnxcore50` frameworks section, which switches it on automatically for Core PowerShell.

title: Enable multiple project.json configurations
